column19: Demographically balanced participants:In general, how important are the following in terms of the legitimacy or validity of the process? (1 is low, 5 is high)
column20: Number of people participating:In general, how important are the following in terms of the legitimacy or validity of the process? (1 is low, 5 is high)
column21: Independent conveners:In general, how important are the following in terms of the legitimacy or validity of the process? (1 is low, 5 is high)

column25: Has your Local Authority, during your tenure as a Councillor, ever conducted any participatory exercises (beyond typical consulations)?
column26: Would you be supportive of a participatory process if initiated by the current leadership of the council?
column27: As a Councillor, do you feel that citizen participation activities overlap with your role as an elected representative?
column28: Should a citizen participation exercise be conducted by your council, would you expect to discuss the results as part of your regular council meeting?
column29: In the event of a citizen participation exercise drawing conclusions / making recommendations that conflict with your own views as a Councillor, which would you give more weight to?
column30: Does holding participatory exercises balance representation problems in one-party councils?
column31: Should participatory processes be authoritative (citizen recommendations should be carried out) or consultative (results are reviewed by council decision making processes)?
column32: Should participatory processes be ad hoc (convened only for specific purpose) or permanent (a recurring process on a policy area)?
